sentences.english: Lu heavy, cold, song dance Innocent Steps.
Meanwhile, two classmates danced by the seaside to entertain us.
sentences.chinese: 两个同学此时也开始在海边翩翩起舞给我们助兴。

sentences.english: She said he was a very good-looking man and a gentleman .
sentences.chinese: 据她说，他是一个风度翩翩，很有教养的人。

sentences.english: As the musicians struck up, the wicker husband and the ugly girl went to dance.
sentences.chinese: 乐师们在演奏，柳条丈夫和丑女孩翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: She'sdressed in a floaty white skirt and a cotton print camisole.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着一条翩翩白裙和印花布紧身衣。

sentences.english: The air was thick with butterflies, lifting, fluttering, settling.
sentences.chinese: 空中满是翩翩飞舞，忽上忽下的各种彩蝶。

sentences.english: Awakes my heart to heart's and eye's delight.
sentences.chinese: 唤醒心儿一起来快乐翩翩。

sentences.english: In an Autumn Lane, which in leaves, in my mind Innocent Steps to take off.
sentences.chinese: 而在一片秋光里，那一地落叶，在我的心中翩翩起飞。

sentences.english: He's a personable entertainer and I hope people see that in him.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位风度翩翩的艺人而我希望人们能这样看他。

sentences.english: Blair was a self-styled regular guy with buckets of charm.
sentences.chinese: 布莱尔风度翩翩，自诩为受欢迎的人。

sentences.english: The most contemptible of the personages in the play is the courtly fop Osric.
sentences.chinese: 剧中最可鄙的人物是风度翩翩的花花公子奥斯里克。

sentences.english: They noticed a beautiful, slim, talkative old man.
sentences.chinese: 他们遇到了一位风姿翩翩，削瘦健谈的老人。

sentences.english: He declares his love and the two dance.
sentences.chinese: 他向奥琳比雅表白，并与她翩翩起舞。

sentences.english: I should soar trippingly like a butterfly.
sentences.chinese: 我应该去翱翔如蝶舞翩翩。

sentences.english: When the return path, not to interest at the time of flying.
sentences.chinese: 归时的路上，不见来时的兴致翩翩。

sentences.english: She was dancing lightly in the georgette skirt, which appears graceful and elegant.
sentences.chinese: 裙子翩翩起舞，显得格外轻盈飘逸。

definition: to float in the air/swiftly/nimbly/easy and relaxed
to float about/to flutter (in the breeze)/(dialect) gay guy/(Tw) ghost
(literary) (of a woman) to have a graceful demeanor/beautiful woman
spry and lively (of dancing and movements)
to fly up/to dance in the air (of snowflakes, flower petals etc)
